title: Polynomial Function - Modeling Number of People

content.question: For time <math alttext="t"><mi>t</mi></math> hours, <math alttext="0 less or equal than t less or equal than 2"><mn>0</mn><mo>≤</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>≤</mo><mn>2</mn></math>, the number of people inside a large shopping center is changing at a rate modeled by the function <math alttext="P"><mi>P</mi></math> given by <math alttext="P open parentheses t close parentheses equals t cubed minus 4 t squared plus 3 t plus 1"><mi>P</mi><mfenced><mi>t</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><msup><mi>t</mi><mn>3</mn></msup><mo>-</mo><mn>4</mn><msup><mi>t</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>+</mo><mn>3</mn><mi>t</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>1</mn></math>, where <math alttext="P open parentheses t close parentheses"><mi>P</mi><mfenced><mi>t</mi></mfenced></math> is measured in hundreds of people per hour. Which of the following gives the time <math alttext="t"><mi>t</mi></math> and reasoning for when the number of people inside the shopping center is at its maximum?

choices.label: <math alttext="t equals 0.451"><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0.451</mn></math>, because the rate of change in the number of people inside the shopping center changes from increasing to decreasing.
<math alttext="t equals 0.451"><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0.451</mn></math>, because the rate of change in the number of people inside the shopping center changes from positive to negative.
<math alttext="t equals 1.445"><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1.445</mn></math>, because the rate of change in the number of people inside the shopping center changes from increasing to decreasing.
<math alttext="t equals 1.445"><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1.445</mn></math>, because the rate of change in the number of people inside the shopping center changes from positive to negative.

content.answer: <math alttext="t equals 1.445"><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1.445</mn></math>, because the rate of change in the number of people inside the shopping center changes from positive to negative.
